stories.title: YC startups hiring for biology, life sciences, chemistry and data informatic
Abandoned pits of former mining town fuel green revolution

stories.text:
I am looking for good references on software design/engineering principles that I can implement personally and for my team of statisticians.

I am a physicist by training, and have created some questionable code and programs as part of my PhD. I am currently a 'data scientist', at a research center and manage a small army of statisticians. For the most part most of the coding is hacking together different scripts in a stats software of choice to do analysis. Overtime our analysis is getting more sophisticated and complex, and would like to implement some better coding practices to eliminate a lot of common bugs and to make our work more sharable. I will also most likely be looking for another job in a year or two, and would like to improve my practice as well.
stories.title: Ask HN: Software engineering/design references for Statisticians
